title: Alexandru Fronea
text:
Alexandru Fronea (15 November 1933 – 10 April 2013) was a <a href="Romania">Romania</a>n <a href="association%20football">football</a> <a href="Defender%20%28association%20football%29">defender</a> who played for <a href="Romania%20national%20football%20team">Romania</a> in the <a href="1960%20European%20Nations%27%20Cup">1960 European Nations' Cup</a>.
Club career.
He was a member of <a href="FC%20Petrolul%20Ploie%C8%99ti">FC Petrolul Ploiești</a>'s "golden generation". He became national champion two times with Petrolul, in 1958 and 1959 and won the <a href="Romanian%20Cup">Romanian Cup</a> in 1963.
International career.
Fronea earned his one and only cap for the <a href="Romania%20national%20football%20team">Romania</a> on 29 May 1960 in a <a href="1960%20European%20Nations%27%20Cup%20qualifying">European Nations' Cup qualifying</a> match against <a href="Czechoslovakia%20national%20football%20team">Czechoslovakia</a>.
